div.p: This case-insensitive code system http://testSK.org/CodeSystem/stroke-etiology-cs defines the following codes:

tr.td: Specifies that large artery atherosclerosis (for example, significant stenosis in the carotid or basilar arteries) was identified as the cause of the stroke.
Specifies that the stroke etiology falls into a rarer category not covered by the main classifications, such as vasculitis or hypercoagulable states.
Specifies that the stroke is attributed to small vessel disease, often manifesting as a lacunar infarct.

description.value: Codes indicating the etiology of strokes.

purpose.value: To provide locally governed codes for classifying ischemic stroke etiology.

copyright.value: Â© Tecnomod. This CodeSystem is provided for use within this Implementation Guide.

definition.value: Specifies that large artery atherosclerosis (for example, significant stenosis in the carotid or basilar arteries) was identified as the cause of the stroke.
Specifies that the stroke etiology falls into a rarer category not covered by the main classifications, such as vasculitis or hypercoagulable states.
Specifies that the stroke is attributed to small vessel disease, often manifesting as a lacunar infarct.
